Key Match Events: In the 40th minute, midfielder Nguyen Thanh Binh pulled the shirt of Rafael Struick inside the box, leading to a penalty which Asanwi Mangkualam converted to give Indonesia the lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Indonesia have a quality squad with naturalized players.
Vietnam did not have their best form in the first half, struggling to keep possession as they did in the game with Japan.
Vietnam missed their star Nguyen Dinh Bac in this game due to injury, and his replacement Nguyen Van Tung did not meet expectations.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Troussier said he was disappointed by the defeat and regretted the small mistake that led to the penalty.
Troussier praised Nguyen Thanh Binh for his improved performance in the second half.
He expressed pride in the team's strong fight until the end despite the loss.
Vietnam will continue to fight for three points in their last game against Iraq.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia squad, with players that have better physique, often won in one on one situations and committed many fouls.
Vietnam got eliminated from Asian Cup group stage for the first time after losing 0-1 to Indonesia.
